title: Yasuo's windwall and the definition of projectile
body: There are many so called broken abilities in league and many people will argue both for and against those abilities. I truly believe Yasuo's **windwall** is severely broken and its actually not so much the ability but riots definition of a projectile. A projectile is usually defined as: a body projected or impelled forward, as through the air. Hence the important wording through the air, but Yasuo's **windwall** stops more than just things flying through the air, like Braum's ult which is literally a fissure in the ground, Nami's ult which is a wave and rolls over the ground, yet for some reason Nautilus ult does go through the **windwall** so riot is at best inconsistent with the **windwall** If anyone can PLEASE tell me if you know another basic skill that blocks **28 different Ults**. This is undoubtedly broken and needs to be fixed, I know its an old topic but I don't think it has been properly addressed.

replies.body:
A projectile in game is defined as having a travel time, travel speed, and travel distance. There are few projectiles that are coded as units and are thus stopped from moving further but not destroyed (Olaf ax, Ori ball, Jhin and Teemo traps, etc.). Don't try to bring realistic physics into a fantasy themed game (biggest key word: GAME).
